revision.text: Possibly: The principles of natural law. In which the true systems of morality and civil government are established; and the different sentiments of Grotius, Hobbes, Puffendorf, Barbeyrac, Locke, Clark, and Hutchinson, occasinally considered. By J. J. Burlamaqui, Counsellor of State, and late Professor of Natural and Civil Law Geneva. Translated into English by Mr. Nugent.
